name: POST_ips-pools-pool_name-ips
description:
**This endpoint allows you to add an IP address to an IP pool.**

You can add the same IP address to multiple pools. It may take up to 60 seconds for your IP address to be added to a pool after your request is made.

Before you can add an IP to a pool, you need to activate it in your SendGrid account:

1. Log into your SendGrid account.  
1. Navigate to **Settings** and then select **IP Addresses**.  
1. Find the IP address you want to activate and then click **Edit**.  
1. Check **Allow my account to send mail using this IP address**.
1. Click **Save**.

You can retrieve all of your available IP addresses from the "Retrieve all IP addresses" endpoint.

pool_name.description: The name of the IP pool you want to add the address to. If the name contains spaces, they must be URL encoded (e.g., "Test Pool" becomes "Test%20Pool").

ip.description: The IP address that you want to add to the named pool.

$ul: **pools**: The IP pools that this IP address has been added to.
**start_date**: A Unix timestamp indicating when the warmup process began for the added IP address.
**warmup**: Indicates if the IP address is in warmup.
